bibl.title: Despatch from Beverly Y. Payne to George L. Rives, April 30, 1888
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p: Consulate General of the United States. Monrovia, Liberia, April 30th 1888.
Mr B. Y. Payne to the Assistant Secretary of State
Requisition of the Legation at Monrovia, Liberia.

Sir. I have the honor to request that you furnish this Legation with the following forms, Nos 100, 101, 102, 103, 112 & 120 (See U.S. Consular Regulation 1881 pages 189 & 190.) I beg to request that you send a large quantity.
Hon. George L. Rives, Ass't Sec'y of State

quantity as I have a letter from the Consular Agent at Elmina, requesting a supply, and this LEgation is bare of each most especially nos 140, 103, 101 & 102 my predecessor Mr Taylor having used many during his ohert stay here to no affect, by filling them in his name as Consul General, to (See enclosure) as if he was in office forever: to erase his name to will be
I have the honor to be Sir, Your obedient Servant
Enclosures Form No 140 used by Mr Taylor
